RSVP for "Fire in the West: Appreciating the Inevitable," a presentation and Q&A by Dr. Larissa Yocom, at the link in our bio!

Tuesday, June 22 @ 11:30am

--->Fire is a beneficial part of many ecosystems, but in recent decades more and more people have moved into the wildland-urban interface, setting the stage for more “problem fires” that affect the places where many Utahns live, work, and play. We have some choice in how or when wildfires occur, but it’s counterproductive to remove all fire from the landscape. Adjusting our perception of fire as a natural and necessary tool rather than purely as a threat can help us better manage our landscapes and future fires.<---

💧🌎 Día Mundial de la Lucha Contra la Desertificación y la Sequía 🌎💧

👉🏻 Hoy 17 de junio se conmemora este día con fin de crear conciencia sobre la importancia que tiene dar soluciones a los problemas de desertificación y sequía.

🌱 La vegetación ayuda a reducir el riesgo de sequía, ya que aumenta la humedad, reduce la oxidación térmica y provee servicios ecosistémicos tales como regular caudales y controlar la dinámica del carbono.

🌵 Los paisajes degradados y poco planificados hacen que sea más difícil la sobrevivencia del bosque, por lo que la lucha contra la desertificación es también una lucha contra los paisajes degradados.

Every year, World Day to Combat Desertification & Drought is observed to promote public awareness of international efforts to combat desertification and drought, as well as to serve as a reminder that "... land degradation neutrality is achievable through problem-solving, strong community involvement and co-operation at all levels." (UN)
-
Land degradation is inextricably linked to the fashion industry. From badly managed terrestrial agriculture used to grow materials like cotton and hemp, to mass amounts of water used to process and dye clothing, fashion's exploitation of land and water cannot be understated.
-
"By 2030, the fashion industry is predicted to use 35 per cent more land – over 115 million hectares, equivalent to the size of Colombia." (UN)
.
.
.

Today we're raising awareness for World Day to Combat Desertification and Drought.

Through our demand for food, materials, and shelter, we have drastically changed the environment around us. Land degradation negatively impacts the lives of more than 3.2 billion people around the world. 

This year's goals outlined by unccd emphasize the need to invest in restoring land as part of a green recovery that has wide-reaching benefits:

🌎 Economic resilience by creating jobs & raising incomes 
🌍Increasing food security
🌏Protecting biodiversity 

#RestorationLandRecovery #DesertificationAndDroughtDay #EndLandLoss #climatecrisis #climatechange #desertification #drought #economicresiliency

As wildfire season comes around again, state leaders are discussing steps they're taking to reduce risk. They also highlight the importance of conserving water, especially during times of drought. You can help conserve water at your own home by switching to drip irrigation, planting a drought-friendly garden, and using rain barrels to capture water. Check out our website for more tips and rebates to help you!💧♻️

El Día Mundial de Lucha Contra la Desertificación y la Sequía, se celebra el 17 de junio de cada año. El decreto fue establecido por la ONU, con el objetivo de crear conciencia de la importancia que tiene para los seres humanos y el planeta abordar y dar soluciones a los problemas de desertificación y sequía, los cuales representan graves problemas presentes y futuros para toda la humanidad.⠀
⠀
Para el año 2021 el tema central de la campaña de esta efeméride es "Suelo sano = gente sana" con Costa Rica como país anfitrión, el cual tiene como objetivo fundamental transformar las tierras degradadas en tierras sanas.⠀
⠀
Fuente: www.diainternacionalde.com

It's hot. Like really hot. Not just your sunny California summer day hot. It's climate change is real and we should not be dealing with this heat hot. But it's not just the heat. It's the drought. And the wind. And all of it coming together to create dangerous wildfire conditions. I've lived in the Monterey Bay Area for more than fifteen years and I've never seen it like this. The ground crunches under my feat when I walk. The dust kicks up when the animals frolic and play. The morning dew evaporates before it even touches the Earth. We are filling waters and offering cool treats and making piggy mud pits to keep everyone safe and cool. Petunia is as happy as can be. But I worry. I fear for the future if this trend continues. And it will as long humans refuse to change, deny accountability for our destruction, and continue down this unsustainable path. 
#drought #climatechange #californiafires #sanctuarylife #friendsnotfood #liberationforall #littlehillsanctuary

Held on June 17th, Desertification and Drought Day is focused on turning degraded land into healthy land. The restoration of degraded land brings economic resilience, creates jobs, raises incomes and increases food security. 

Restoring degraded land brings economic resilience, creates jobs, raises incomes and increases food security. It helps biodiversity to recover. It locks away the atmospheric carbon warming the Earth, slowing climate change. It can also lessen the impacts of climate change and underpin a green recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic. LAND is part of the solution! Link In Bio to learn more.

◼ Ziua mondială de combatere a deşertificării şi secetei este marcată în fiecare an, pe 17 iunie.
◼️ Acestă zi are ca obiectiv transformarea terenurilor degradate, în terenuri sănătoase.
◼ Reabilitarea terenurilor degradate aduce rezistență economică, creează locuri de muncă, crește veniturile și crește securitatea alimentară.
◼️ Această zi are scopul de a reaminti tuturor că neutralitatea degradării terenurilor este realizabilă doar prin implicarea puternică a comunității și cooperarea la nivel internațional.

#Abholzung und Übernutzung zerstören weltweit immer mehr fruchtbare Böden. Daran erinnert der heutige Welttag zur Bekämpfung von Wüstenbildung und Dürre. Für viele Kleinbäuer*innen im #Globalen Süden ist oft schon eine einzige ausgefallene Ernte existenzbedrohend. Deshalb sorgen wir in unserer Projektarbeit dafür, dass Böden vor Abtragungen geschützt wird und sich das Wasser wieder anreichern kann. Wie das funktioniert? Beispielsweise durch das Anlegen von Erdwällen und Konturgräben oder das Errichten von Steinmauern, wie hier in der Marathwada Region. Nach drei Projektjahren hat sich dort das Erscheinungsbild der Landschaft vollkommen gewandelt: das Gelände wurde terrassiert und es wurden über 30.000 Obstbäume neu gepflanzt. Die Kleinbäuer*innen berichten, dass die Wasserstände in ihren Feldbrunnen um zwei bis drei Meter erhöht sind und gerade in Phasen ausbleibender Regelfälle nun eine erntesichernde Bewässerung möglich ist.

World day to combat desertification and drought. 

Here in the UK we might not be facing a desert but with the combination of an increased population and climate change water companies throughout the UK are predicting a deficit of water in the coming 25 years.*

Below are some water saving suggestions. 

1. If you are lucky enough to have a garden, don’t use the sprinkler, half and hour of sprinkler use is equivalent to the water use of an average family of 4 in a day. 

2. Reducing your shower time by one minute will save 10 litres of water per wash. 

3. Running a tap can use 6 litres of water a minute - turn it off if you are not using it. 

4. If you have a dual flush loo, using the smaller flush were you can will save 2 litres per flush

5. Change to using water saving products such as a shampoo bar !

* Thames water predicts a deficit of 350 million lites of water a day by 2045 if no action is taken.

we are in a climate emergency ‼️
☀️ while I must admit, this Seattle sunshine is a welcomed departure from our typical June gloom, it's getting served up this year with a side of crippling climate anxiety
🔥 we're seeing dangerous drought conditions already - long before the hottest, driest months of the year. vegetation is already terrifyingly dry. heat waves have already begun. the fires are coming.
🌎 this is a reminder that climate change isn't a far off threat. it's here and now and it's inescapable. if there was ever a time to double down on activism, action, lifestyle changes, etc - it's now.

World Day to Combat Desertification and Droughts 🌍🍂

Every day we use litres and litres of water without ever reflecting on how much is wasted on futile and unnecessary uses.

Learning to use water correctly is not just a question of economics, but of caring for the planet.

Every day we must do those little things that can save us money: turn off the taps when brushing our teeth, prefer showers to baths and always run washing machines and dishwashers with a full load.

Small steps for a more sustainable future!

#rivercleaning #desertification #drought #worlddesertificationday #lesswaterconsumption

😲Today almost half of the world's population is directly or indirectly affected by land degradation!

Desertification does not refer to the expansion of existing deserts. It actually occurs because dryland ecosystems are highly vulnerable to overexploitation and inappropriate land use, such as overgrazing, deforestation, and soil pollution.

What can you do? 🌱

✔Get informed about our land issues and spread the message.
✔Promote sustainable systems as the circular economy to combat desertification.
✔Plant a tree (it helps!)
🧐Read the next post for an inspiring story about the powerful effect of planting trees. 
✔Get to know circular and ethical products, aware of our environment, and care about it. 

🏡Visit us at www.shopc.io  to find out circular products.
